info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cleveland County through 300 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shelby. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Lawndale, Patterson Springs, Fallston, Lattimore, Waco, Earl, Kingstown, Belwood and Polkville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
